reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great hotel, right in the centre of Buenos Aires, but felt safe walking around at night. Staff were incredibly helpful and obligingly spoke English when faced with our especially poor Spanish. Spacious, clean, modern room. Good selection for breakfast. Fitness room was very small, but sauna looked brand new! Upgraded to a suite on the last night- no extra charge and was even more spacious and luxurious with free bathrobes etc. Also stored some baggage for us for 4 days which was very useful. Its actually right next door to Tango Porteno- which we had unknowingly booked for a show and I would also recommend for an entertaining evening. All in all- very enjoyable!
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel exceeds expectations in price value relationship. Especially in the service provided at the front desk by Alejandro. I guarantee he is the best concierge I've ever met, by providing a super professional work, friendly, smiling and always smiling and giving the solution in response. Alejandro stands above the rest.
reviews.title: Not a good choice

reviews.text: Location was central but the area is not safe, esp at night (according to local friends). Lots of inter-city buses start/stop from the road just outside the hotel so it was very congested. For the price (almost US$200), the rooms are very small-had to pay extra to upgrade to a deluxe room (which was better). Reception was helpful but everything else about the hotel including the BF was mediocre. I would recommend staying at Recoleta, Palermo or Santa Fe areas which are much nicer and trendier neighbourhoods with delightful shops and cafes.
reviews.title: Really Nice Modern Hotel, Excellent Location, Friendly and Helpful Staff.

reviews.text: Spent one night pre luxury cruise, and not sure why Azamara does not offer five star choice for pre-cruise night(s) in keeping with high standards of this cruise line. Loved exploring beautiful BA, did not love this hotel. Rooms small, service just okay, breakfast mediocre at best. Not the best beginning to an upscale South America journey. Best that can be said is great convenience to terrific tango show next door, that I was skeptical about but ended up loving. If you are fussy, this place is not for you. If you like Courtyards, then you will be safisfied.
reviews.title: Ordinary and small

reviews.text: Great Rooms, breakfest and staff! Very recommended.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days during our honeymoon, and it was my favorite place of our month-long vacation through South America. We paid a bit more than we usually like to, but it was well worth it. HUGE room, with an amazing and gigantic bathroom (with a tub and a really nice walk-in shower.). There was was lots of closet space to put all our things, and a safe to lock up important items. I thought the breakfast was wonderful, and we set an alarm every day so we would't miss it. Heading out the door we were right on the famous 9 de Julio and a short walk from lots of sights and restaurants.
reviews.title: Huge room and a stellar view of the obelisk!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Could be excellent, but annoying payment issues

reviews.text: They charge for wireless (why do all the expensive places always charge?)
reviews.title: good choice, but not for long stays

reviews.text: The NH Tango is in the center of the action. It is located on 9 De Julio.. one of the widest streets in the world and near the Opera House and the leading pedestrian street. You can't find a better place to call home while visiting Buenos Aires. The staff was friendly and mostly helpful. The third floor restaurant had a nice breakfast with a friendly staff. The Tango Theater right next door offers some splendid dancing and nice dinner for a reasonable price.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel In A Great Location..

reviews.text: My only problem with South American hotels is the late check in times that adhered to with an almost religious fervor. We arrived at Noon and had to leave our luggage and return three hours later to get into our room. It is just a hassle to walk around in your traveling clothes.
reviews.title: A safe option

reviews.text: Buenos Aires is unique city. It is a blend of the old and the new. The city's infrastructure is a little worn from past economic woes but the country and the city are on the rise and everywhere you look things are being upgraded and renovated. The people are kind, helpful and there are a ton of things to see and do. We never felt unsafe and had no problem with crime or criminals. I am sure there are criminals around in every major city but if you are aware and stay in the busy areas you shouldn't have any problems. I would say the same about Los Angeles or New York.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel,good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there for several days and only scratched the surface of the city. Take a guided tour of the city when you first get there and use it to decide what you want to see. We took a private tour but bus tours, hop on and hop off buses and city tours are available. A private three hour tour by car only costs about $100 plus a tip. The city streets are crowded and I wouldn't rent a car unless you know your way around the city and how to avoid the traffic jams and some of the Argentine drivers.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.text: The cafes and restaurants are great. The Argentine beef is delicious. If you can visit the old port area, do so, for some great dining. Buenos Aires is a great place to visit in the winter months in North America. We had 80 degree weather and sunshine in late January and early February.
reviews.title: Business Trip with a 2 month old baby
